thread.title: L-L football: York Suburban deals Ephrata a 38-6 loss
thread.title_full: L-L football: York Suburban deals Ephrata a 38-6 loss

author: STAFF REPORT | SPORTS@LNPNEWS.COM
title: L-L football: York Suburban deals Ephrata a 38-6 loss
text:
Comments 
Ephrata Mountaineers (Courtesy of the Pennsylvania Helmet Project) 
Dajour Henderson and Collin Mailman each came up with a pair of touchdowns Friday night, and York Suburban ran away from visiting Ephrata in a nonleague matchup. 
Mailman opened the scoring for Suburban (3-2) with 6:40 to play in the first quarter, taking a 13-yard catch from QB Tom Merkle. Mailman then ran for the two-point conversion, and Suburban hit the gas from there. 
The Trojans powered in four more scores in the second quarter. 
Henderson picked up two 23-yard TD runs, then Merkle and Mailman hooked up on the night’s big-ticket play, a 63-yard scoring strike. With 1:41 to go before halftime, Teague Hoffman added one more score, rumbling in from the 1. The Trojans also added a fourth-quarter safety. 
For the Mounts (0-5), quarterback Jerad Malmer broke up the shutout, scoring from the 4 with 1:35 to go in the game. Malmer was 3 for 7 for 20 yards passing Friday, and led Ephrata’s ground game with 43 yards on 17 carries. 
Henderson was Suburban’s top rusher, picking up 82 yards on six carries. Merkle finished 8 for 14 for 146 yards in the air. 
The Mounts return to L-L Section Three action next Friday, hosting Annville-Cleona. More Headlines
